title: Calories in a Roll of Sushi
meta_description: Discover calories in roll of sushi, including macros like carbs, protein, fat, plus variations and FAQs for better meal planning.
h1: Calories in a Roll of Sushi
assumptions: Standard California roll (imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, sushi rice, nori seaweed); 6 pieces, ~200 g total, no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by roll type, ingredients, rice portion, and preparation; sushi often includes soy sauce which adds sodium. Check restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical sushi roll contains about 255 kcal, mostly from rice carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a California roll of sushi?
faqs.a: About 255 kcal for a standard 6-piece roll.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a roll of sushi?
faqs.a: Around 42 g, primarily from sushi rice.

faqs.q: Is a sushi roll high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~650 mg per roll due to rice seasoning and nori.

faqs.q: How does roll type affect calories in roll of sushi?
faqs.a: Fried or creamy rolls add 100+ kcal; simple fish rolls are lower.

faqs.q: Protein in a roll of sushi?
faqs.a: Typically 9 g from fish or veggies; varies by filling.
